tweets.text: @StinkStopthe @Emsbarr @GBNEWS What‚Äôs going on?
@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe My house got flooded with landfill gas last night, everything stinks downstairs now, contaminated and polluted !!!!!

#Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3

@Sian29337182 @MrMarkwarren1 Hottest March Day  in 52 years... quite a balmy evening 14 degrees. This does not bode well for the summer. ü§Æü§Æü§¢When will @NewsNBC be providing Hazmat suits for the summer? Or is that @PHE_uk BTW just checking are  the monitors on @EnvAgencyMids #stopthestink @stopthestink https://t.co/idNnt8Kgmh

Another HUGE result for our campaign. Now North Marsh transformed at Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp). Water level up, large debris GONE. More action like this, @CanalRiverTrust! Thank you. Big message to public that owners care. Silt and microplastics next!‚úäüèûÔ∏è https://t.co/Udm56Aj3GF

tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

@barnet_rebel @BrokenBarnet @LLPasture @BarnetCouncil @LondonFire @EnvAgency @LDN_environment @WildLondon @BarnetTimes @metpoliceuk @savebutterflies @iGiGL @WildHomesLondon Donald. Happy to take up. Will direct message you.

tweets.text: @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Had to close bedroom window last night around 11.00pm. Rancid. Have given up reporting on ach incidence now. Nothing changes.

Pre-breeding season, we & the Wildlife Conservation Partnership have replaced barn owl & kestrel boxes we installed together in the Branston Island area in 2002, which alongside grassland restoration & sympathetic mowing of riverbanks has contributed to pairs breeding annuallyüëç https://t.co/bRjsTzDaR7

@EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC it's nights like last night that we need people on the ground investigating the smell from #WalleysQuarry, it seems to have been intense and to have spread far and wide across the borough. 4 hours broken sleep. #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL

‚¨áÔ∏èA clip of myself and @zahradaronville on @itvnews last night, showing @BenChapmanITV the new #NativeOyster nurseries at Sunderland Marina and @PortofBlyth. #MakingSpace4Nature #MarineRestoration @EnvAgencyYNE @GWKNE @Adventure_Sund https://t.co/dXiDdxT3EY

tweets.text: I am reaching out to @EmmaHowardBoyd and @JamesBevanEA for help. I can‚Äôt seem to get anywhere with this. The @EnvAgency just don‚Äôt seen to recognise there is an issue on the River Mardyke. If anyone else knows how we can resolve this @HertsFarmer @InnesThomson https://t.co/AaTqYyV57K

What was the point of a Green Summit @AndyBurnhamGM if the rivers of NW England are treated as little more than open sewers? These data represent a complete failure of environmental regulation @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgencyNW @unitedutilities

tweets.text:
Julia gets it, Hugo gets it.

What about those in charge of this sorry mess @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency? https://t.co/VdoFZZFjtm
@RHarrabin @EnvAgency @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3 So have they been fined 400,000 times?

Makes very depressing reading but we suspect things are much worse than the figures show. The @EnvAgency  have a bizarre way of counting spills. For example in 2020 the @RiverChess experienced 50 spills on consecutive days, they counted it as 1 spill. https://t.co/1AXYE2A3a0

We're supporting the @EnvAgency Flood Action Campaign.

In England there are over 5 million homes at risk of flooding, with the average cost of flooding to a home standing at around ¬£30,000. 

Do you know what to do in a flood? This EA page will help you: https://t.co/5IuFFOa67E https://t.co/Qj4aaxSkCS

urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
Martin Hughes and his wife were flooded on Boxing Day 2015

He tells us his story of what it‚Äôs like to be flooded and shares his advice for others üëáüèº 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/whMiqucyL6 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/b52BSUBbky

Data from @EnvAgency. Raw sewage is discharged into our rivers routinely during dry weather. How about applying some pressure @AndyBurnhamGM Manchester‚Äôs rivers are hit hard by this practice. Where is the commitment to enhance river habitats and water quality @EmmaHowardBoyd? https://t.co/KkinZw9sc8

Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows

tweets.text:
Superb to have finally completed this!

It's been designed to be deliberately unstable to allow the stream to build its own habitats and choose its own pathways.

Completed as part of the Action for #Invertebrates project funded by @stwater Great Big Nature Boost https://t.co/EBd7iD0Zem https://t.co/ylMkSoO7oU

Reason to start fitting domestic #greywterreuse systems #waterconservation #watermanagement #waterinnovation #braveblue #netzero #zerocarbonhomes #50lhome #waterwise #buildbackgreener #innovation @bbc @EnvAgency @WorldWaterTech @BBCCountryfile https://t.co/qQ4BSr8jCh

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @darylbuck @GuttfieldArc @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @UnderwaterMedia @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Great - thanks Daryl. Am there now. Needed to escape from my desk! Can‚Äôt see any signs of dead fish. Cetti‚Äôs Warbler singing nearby. Kids jumping off boats into the Thames which I can safely say I have never seen in March before! Very pleasant bike ride.

@GuttfieldArc @AliDriverUK @Feargal_Sharkey @rollingpinboy @Thames21 @UnderwaterMedia @EnvAgencySE @thameswater Hi - I checked with colleagues. No pollution was confirmed a while ago Stranded fish in flooded field went through a pump when draining. Operator advised to screen next time.
@Feargal_Sharkey @defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency Shouldn't @PHE_SouthEast (and other regions) be taking an interest too, given Covid virus is shed thru faeces? Where's the next mutant variant to come from?!
